intro: Nesaea woodii, commonly known as the Wood's nesaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nesaea woodii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
